discussion.content: Key word "on-site" so that means that would rule out hot site. Answer is C) Power Generator

questions.question_text:
A customer wants a technician to implement a solution that will allow its critical on-site servers to continue to function in the event of an extended power outage.
Which of the following should the technician recommend?
Which of the following would an organization MOST likely have employees sign before granting access to confidential data?

discussion.content: non disclosure agreement - keep the confidentality of sensitive data

comments.content: Thank you for this explanation, because I don't remember learning this in class♥

A packet capture using Wireshark can be used to analyze slow file transfers. You can use iperf to measure network performance but I don't know how it can be used to solve/identify a problem with slow file transfers. I am not an expert iperf user but if CompTIA is testing you on this non objective program it seems like a trap question.

discussion.content: perf is a tool for network performance measurement and tuning. It is a cross-platform tool that can produce standardized performance measurements for any network. Iperf has client and server functionality, and can create data streams to measure the throughput between the two ends in one or both directions.
I haven't ran into iPerf in the exam objectives nor Mike Meyer's book.

Selected Answer: B
To get detailed measurement data for slow file transfers, an engineer would MOST likely use a network performance measurement tool such as iPerf.

iPerf is an open-source tool used for measuring network performance, specifically bandwidth and throughput, by generating TCP and UDP data streams between two endpoints. By analyzing the results of an iPerf test, an engineer can identify where network bottlenecks are occurring and how to improve network performance.
This is ackward, I am studying for the N10-008 and this question is on my dump. The answer there is NetFlow Analyzer.
This is a stupid question. I would use A if I am looking for retransmits, B for overall throughput testing, C to see if anything is hogging BW. They don't give enough info to answer.

Is this cisco mixed with network.

you can expect the "Unexpected " in the exam..tomorrow going to sit for the exam..wish me good luck Heroes!!!
I've never heard of iPerf until just now.
IPerf is listed in the CompTIA text. FYI

questions.question_text: A user from a remote office is reporting slow file transfers. Which of the following tools will an engineer MOST likely use to get detailed measurement data?

discussion.content: I thought that answer would be ACL

process of elimination IMO, upgrading firmware should normally on router, router ACL is to allow or deny traffic, patching & updating for vulnerablity.
finally, in the question they want to prevent access to company network.....disabling unused port could do that.
With "B," guests and unauthorized users can *still* gain access... just by using active ports. That's why this answer doesn't make sense to me.
The answer doesn’t make any sense

questions.question_text: A network technician needs to implement a network security control on a switch. The solution needs to be non-invasive and prevent guests and unauthorized users from accessing the company's network. Which of the following would BEST meet these requirements?

A network administrator needs to bring a new building online that houses multiple departments. The departments vary in size, with the smallest having 25 hosts and the largest having 140 hosts. When designing the addressing scheme for the new building, which of the following should the network administrator use lo limit the number of wasted IP addresses?
